body.p:
To his Excelency Beriah Magoffin
Govonor of the Commonwealth of the State of Kentucky

We Your humble petitioners of Owsley County would most respectfully represent Unto Your excellency; that whereas there has been two fines assessed against Richard McQueen, under a charges of a breaches of the peace The circumstances of which are that Richard McQueen was passing the publice highway as a peaceable, orderly & law abiding citizen; & was attaced by one Samuel Cuningham with vicious, slanderous; and insulting, words; to which said Richard merely answered him & made replies to his insults; and that no conflict ensued between them; and that for this & this alone & under those circumstances, Your humble petitioner (who is an orderly; upwright & lawfull citizen) was taken up & fined by a Jury of through motives which are unknown to your petitioners
Wherefore we the undersigned Your petitioners ask that you remit said fines believing as we do that this act of lenity; will express the will of your good citizens generally
The affiant Richard McQueen state that the facts set forth in the above petition are true to the best of his knowledge & belief July 27th 1861
Sworn to by R McQueen before me the undersigned J Roe This July 21st 1861

S. Isaacs
John C. Cole
S. Isaacs J P. O. C
Beaty McQueen
J. C. Hensley

on of the within cases against Dr C K Mcqueen -- was back before me I think he ought not to have been fine a more than a mere nominal sum but the Jury fined him $500 If I were the Governor I would remit it & hope you will
The other case was laid before me would be pleasure to see you remit the fine $5,,
